question: Giants vs. Packers
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for December 11 at 8:15 PM ET:

If the New York Giants win, the market will resolve to “Giants”.

If the Green Bay Packers win, the market will resolve to “Packers”.

 If the game is not completed by December 18, 2023 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: NFL
events.description: This is a market group for NFL games happening on 2023-12-11

question: Dolphins vs. Titans
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for December 11 at 8:15 PM ET:

If the Miami Dolphins win, the market will resolve to “Dolphins”.

If the Tennessee Titans win, the market will resolve to “Titans”.

 If the game is not completed by December 18, 2023 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Kanye release ‘Vultures’ by Friday?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Kanye West’s collab album with Ty Dolla Sign, currently titled ‘Vultures’, is officially released by Friday, December 15, 2023, 11:59 PM PT. 

Officially released means that the album is officially available for download or streaming (not including live events) by the resolution date. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.” 

If the album is named something other than “Vultures” but is still a collab album between Kanye West and Ty Dolla Sign, that album will count for the resolution of this market.

The resolution source will be any official Kanye West streaming or download site, like Apple Music or Spotify.

question: marginfi airdrop by March 1?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if marginfi launches a token and announces they have performed an airdrop between December 10, 2023 and March 1, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market "locked" tokens or non-swappable tokens will not suffice to resolve this market to "Yes".

The primary resolution source for this market is on-chain information and official information from the marginfi team, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce break up by March 1?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce end their romantic relationship by March 1, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Confirmation can come in various forms, including, but not limited to, social media posts, interviews, press releases, official statements, or a consensus of credible reporting. This market will resolve to "No" otherwise.

If it's unclear whether or not they are in a romantic relationship, this market will resolve to the side with the stronger argument based on credible reporting.

question: Another Celestia airdrop by March 1?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Celestia announces they have performed an airdrop between December 10, 2023 and March 1, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". Note - this airdrop must be different from the airdrop which already occurred in October 2023.

For the purposes of this market "locked" tokens or non-swappable tokens will not suffice to resolve this market to "Yes".

The primary resolution source for this market is on-chain information and official information from the Celestia team, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: US inflation >0% from Oct to Nov 2023?
description:
This is a market on a month-to-month inflation, as measured by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (CPI-U), from October to November 2023. Inflation is measured by a change in Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) on a seasonally adjusted basis, reported by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the index increased by more than 0.0 percent (on a seasonally adjusted basis) from October to November 2023 and “No“ otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the BLS November 2023 Consumer Price Index report (https://www.bls.gov/bls/news-release/cpi.htm), currently scheduled to be released on December 12, 2023, at 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data.

----

The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services.

Note: the resolution source for this market will be the official monthly BLS CPI news release which reports seasonally-adjusted month-to-month inflation to only one decimal point (e.g. 0.7%). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market (e.g. if seasonally adjusted month-to-month CPI-U is 0.1%, the market will resolve to “Yes”, if it is 0.0%, this market will resolve to “No”).

question: Elizabeth Warren crypto bill become law by June?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if any cryptocurrency-focused bill introduced by Elizabeth Warren becomes law by June 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For this market to resolve to "Yes" Elizabeth Warren must be the primary sponsor of the bill, not a cosponsor.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the federal government of the United States.

question: Will 'Wonka' gross over $35m over its opening weekend?
description:
This is a market on how much 'Wonka' (2023) will gross domestically on its opening weekend. The “Domestic Weekend” tab on https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl2942927617/ will be used to resolve this market once the values for the 3-day opening weekend (December 15 - December 17) are final (i.e. not studio estimates).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if ‘Wonka' (2023) grosses more than $35,000,000 on its 3-day opening. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Please note, this market will resolve according to the Box Office Mojo number under Domestic Weekend for the 3-day weekend (which typically includes Thursday's previews), regardless of whether domestic refers to only the USA, or to USA and Canada, etc.

If there is no final data available by December 22, 2023, 11:59 PM ET, another credible resolution source will be chosen.

If there is no final data available by December 22, 2023, 11:59 PM ET, another credible resolution source will be chosen.

question: Will Biden be impeached by March 31, 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes“ if the US House of Representatives by simple majority vote to approve or pass one or more articles of impeachment of President Joseph Biden by March 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Neither trial nor conviction by the US Senate, nor removal from office, is necessary to resolve this market to “Yes“.

If President Joseph Biden for any reason ceases to be POTUS before being impeached by March 31, 2024 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from the federal government of the United States, however a consensus of credible reporting will be used.
